name: Dragonfly 2.0
descr: [Dragonfly 2.0](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0074) is a suspected Russian group that has targeted government entities and multiple U.S. critical infrastructure sectors since at least December 2015. (Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A) (Citation: Symantec Dragonfly Sept 2017) There is debate over the extent of overlap between [Dragonfly 2.0](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0074) and [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035), but there is sufficient evidence to lead to these being tracked as two separate groups. (Citation: Fortune Dragonfly 2.0 Sept 2017)(Citation: Dragos DYMALLOY )

alias_descriptions.name: IRON LIBERTY
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)(Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY)

Fortune Dragonfly 2.0 Sept 2017.description: Hackett, R. (2017, September 6). Hackers Have Penetrated Energy Grid, Symantec Warns. Retrieved June 6, 2018.

Secureworks MCMD July 2019.description: Secureworks. (2019, July 24). MCMD Malware Analysis. Retrieved August 13, 2020.

Symantec Dragonfly Sept 2017.description: Symantec Security Response. (2017, September 6). Dragonfly: Western energy sector targeted by sophisticated attack group. Retrieved September 9, 2017.

US-CERT TA18-074A.description: US-CERT. (2018, March 16). Alert (TA18-074A): Russian Government Cyber Activity Targeting Energy and Other Critical Infrastructure Sectors. Retrieved June 6, 2018.
